fig.title: Dry Contact External Permissive Signal Connection

image.href: C:\Users\e9921013\backup\GIT\GIT DITA Maps\PDI\PDI Revised Files Ready for GIT\WR22039 0000012247_P-164001123 PowerHub 2 Power Distribution Unit 400-1125 kVA Installation and Operation Manual\Graphics\40.pdf

li.p: The internal permissive signal using the Color Monitor requires no wiring at the customer site.

For a two-stage system, an external permissive signal must be provided at the customer site by wiring a NO dry contact to terminal block TB8 in the Monitoring Compartment. The PDU is shipped with a jumper in TB8 which permanently enables the internal Color Monitor process. One Stage SKRU key release: The jumper in TB8 keeps external permissive signal permanently CLOSED or ENABLED. Two Stage SKRU key release: Remove jumper in TB8 . Connect NO dry contact. Closing the dry contact enables the Color Monitor synch and SKRU key release process. PowerHub 2 PDU Monitoring Compartment PDU is shipped with jumper installed in terminal block TB8 PowerHub 2 PDU 400-1125 kVA 74 Ctrl Nr: DOC15315-007 Remove the jumper and connect the external NO dry contact. Closing the NO dry contact enables the internal process using the Color Monitor synch screen.

For a system using an external permissive signal only, the PDU is configured in manufacturing to bypass the Color Monitor Synch process. At the customer site, the jumper in TB8 must be removed and the external NO dry contact wired to TB8, the same as for a 2-stage system.
